name: Spaghetti Carbonara
cooking_instructions: Boil pasta. Mix eggs, cheese, and pepper. Cook guanciale until crispy. Toss pasta with egg mixture and guanciale.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
cooking_instructions: Cream butter and sugar. Mix in dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
cooking_instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. Grill or bake. Simmer in tomato-cream sauce with garlic and ginger.

name: Caesar Salad
cooking_instructions: Chop lettuce. Whisk dressing ingredients. Toss lettuce with dressing, croutons, and Parmesan.

name: Banana Bread
cooking_instructions: Mash bananas. Mix with melted butter, sugar, and eggs. Fold in dry ingredients. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 50-60 minutes.

name: Margherita Pizza
cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C). Stretch dough, layer with sliced tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil. Drizzle olive oil and bake for 10-15 minutes.

name: Buttermilk Pancakes
cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Whisk in buttermilk, egg, and melted butter. Cook on a greased griddle until bubbles form, then flip.

name: Guacamole
cooking_instructions: Mash avocados. Mix with diced onion, tomato, jalapeño, cilantro, lime juice, and salt. Serve immediately.

name: Beef Tacos
cooking_instructions: Brown beef with seasoning. Warm tortillas. Assemble with beef, lettuce, tomato, cheese, and sour cream.

name: Hummus
cooking_instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and cumin until smooth. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle paprika.

name: Apple Pie
cooking_instructions: Roll out crust. Toss sliced apples with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon. Fill crust, dot with butter, and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45-50 minutes.

name: Croissants
cooking_instructions: Make laminated dough with layers of butter. Roll, fold, and chill repeatedly. Shape into crescents and bake at 400°F (200°C) for 15-20 minutes.

name: Beef Bourguignon
cooking_instructions: Sear beef and bacon. Sauté vegetables. Deglaze with wine. Simmer with herbs for 2-3 hours until tender.

name: Sushi Rolls
cooking_instructions: Season rice with vinegar. Layer rice on nori, add fillings, roll tightly with a bamboo mat. Slice and serve with soy sauce.

name: Pad Thai
cooking_instructions: Soak noodles. Stir-fry protein, add noodles, sauce, and toss. Top with peanuts, bean sprouts, and lime wedges.

name: Lasagna
cooking_instructions: Layer cooked lasagna sheets with meat sauce, ricotta, and cheeses. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes.

name: Ramen
cooking_instructions: Simmer broth with soy sauce. Cook noodles. Assemble bowls with broth, noodles, sliced pork, egg, nori, and green onions.

name: Tiramisu
cooking_instructions: Dip ladyfingers in espresso. Layer with whipped mascarpone mixture. Dust with cocoa. Chill 4+ hours.

name: Greek Salad
cooking_instructions: Chop vegetables and olives. Top with feta, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle oregano.

name: Fish and Chips
cooking_instructions: Batter fish in beer-flour mix. Fry until golden. Serve with fried potato wedges and tartar sauce.

name: Chicken Curry
cooking_instructions: Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger. Add curry paste and chicken. Simmer in coconut milk until cooked.

name: Quiche Lorraine
cooking_instructions: Pre-bake crust. Layer bacon and cheese. Pour egg-cream mixture over. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 35 minutes.

name: Miso Soup
cooking_instructions: Heat dashi stock. Dissolve miso paste. Add tofu and seaweed. Garnish with green onions.

name: Ratatouille
cooking_instructions: Sauté onions and garlic. Layer sliced vegetables in a dish. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 40 minutes.

name: Panna Cotta
cooking_instructions: Heat cream, sugar, and vanilla. Dissolve gelatin. Pour into molds. Chill 4+ hours. Serve with berries.

name: Chicken Noodle Soup
cooking_instructions: Sauté veggies. Add broth, chicken, and noodles. Simmer until noodles are tender. Season with thyme.

name: Churros
cooking_instructions: Boil water, flour, and salt to make dough. Pipe into hot oil. Fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon sugar.

name: Bibimbap
cooking_instructions: Cook rice. Sauté vegetables and beef. Assemble in a bowl with a fried egg. Serve with gochujang.

name: Garlic Bread
cooking_instructions: Mix butter, garlic, and parsley. Spread on sliced baguette. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes.

name: Cheesecake
cooking_instructions: Mix cream cheese, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Pour into crust. Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 50 minutes. Chill overnight.

name: French Onion Soup
cooking_instructions: Caramelize onions in butter. Add broth and herbs. Simmer. Top with toasted baguette and cheese. Broil.

name: Falafel
cooking_instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight. Process with herbs and spices. Form into balls. Fry until golden.

name: Shepherd's Pie
cooking_instructions: Mash potatoes with butter and milk. Brown lamb. Layer meat and vegetables. Top with mashed potatoes. Bake.

name: Gazpacho
cooking_instructions: Blend vegetables with bread and olive oil. Chill. Serve with diced vegetable garnish.

name: Macarons
cooking_instructions: Sift dry ingredients. Make meringue. Fold into batter. Pipe and bake. Fill with ganache.

name: Chicken Fajitas
cooking_instructions: Sauté chicken and vegetables with seasoning. Serve with warm tortillas and toppings.

name: Victoria Sponge Cake
cooking_instructions: Cream butter and sugar. Bake layers. Sandwich with jam and cream.

name: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
cooking_instructions: Soak rice paper. Fill with shrimp, noodles and vegetables. Serve with sauce.

name: Paella Valenciana
cooking_instructions: Brown meats. Add rice and saffron. Cook with stock. Form socarrat.

name: Fudgy Brownies
cooking_instructions: Melt butter and chocolate. Mix with sugar and eggs. Bake at 325°F for 25-35 minutes.

name: Chicken Alfredo
cooking_instructions: Cook pasta. Make cream sauce with Parmesan. Combine with chicken.

name: Scones
cooking_instructions: Cut butter into flour. Add milk. Bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.

name: Kimchi Fried Rice
cooking_instructions: Sauté kimchi and rice. Fry eggs. Combine and serve.

name: New England Clam Chowder
cooking_instructions: Make roux. Add vegetables and clams. Simmer with cream.

name: Moussaka
cooking_instructions: Layer eggplant and lamb sauce. Top with béchamel. Bake.

name: Crème Brûlée
cooking_instructions: Make custard. Chill. Caramelize sugar topping.

name: Ceviche
cooking_instructions: Marinate fish in lime juice. Serve with vegetables.

name: Shakshuka
cooking_instructions: Simmer tomato sauce. Poach eggs in sauce. Serve with bread.

name: Black Forest Gateau
cooking_instructions: Soak layers with Kirsch. Layer with cream and cherries.

name: Chicken Gumbo
cooking_instructions: Make dark roux. Add vegetables and chicken. Simmer.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
cooking_instructions: Steam rice. Mix with coconut milk. Serve with mango.

name: Arancini
cooking_instructions: Form rice balls with cheese. Bread and fry.

name: Avocado Toast
cooking_instructions: Toast the bread. Mash the avocado with salt, pepper, and olive oil. Spread the mixture on the toast. Sprinkle red pepper flakes if desired.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
cooking_instructions: Dip eggplant slices in egg then breadcrumbs. Fry lightly in olive oil until golden. Layer in a baking dish with marinara, mozzarella, Parmesan, and basil. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25-30 minutes.

name: Mushroom Risotto
cooking_instructions: Sauté onions, garlic, and mushrooms in olive oil and butter. Stir in rice until lightly toasted. Add white wine, then gradually incorporate warm stock while stirring continuously. Finish with Parmesan and adjust seasoning.

name: Lemon Drizzle Cake
cooking_instructions: Cream butter with sugar and lemon zest. Beat in eggs one at a time. Fold in flour and baking powder. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40 minutes. Mix lemon juice with powdered sugar and drizzle over the warm cake.

name: Fish Tacos
cooking_instructions: Season fish with taco seasoning and grill until cooked. Warm the tortillas. Assemble tacos with fish, shredded cabbage, a squeeze of lime, a drizzle of crema, and chopped cilantro.

name: Zucchini Bread
cooking_instructions: Mix eggs, oil, and sugar. Stir in flour, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon. Fold in zucchini (and walnuts, if using). Pour into a loaf pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

name: Shrimp Scampi
cooking_instructions: Cook linguine according to package instructions. In a pan, sauté garlic in butter and olive oil, add shrimp and cook until pink. Pour in white wine and lemon juice, then toss with linguine and garnish with parsley.

name: Vegan Buddha Bowl
cooking_instructions: Cook quinoa as per package directions. Roast sweet potato cubes until tender. Assemble quinoa, chickpeas, kale, sweet potato, avocado, and bell pepper in a bowl. Drizzle with a tahini-lemon dressing made by mixing tahini, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

name: BBQ Ribs
cooking_instructions: Rub ribs with paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Drizzle with apple cider vinegar. Slow-cook in the oven or smoker at low heat (around 275°F/135°C) for 2-3 hours. Baste with BBQ sauce during the last 30 minutes.

name: Cinnamon Rolls
cooking_instructions: Combine flour, yeast, sugar, salt, milk, melted butter, and egg to form a dough. Let rise, then roll out and spread with a mixture of brown sugar and cinnamon. Roll up, slice, and bake at 375°F (190°C) for 25 minutes. Drizzle with icing after cooling slightly.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Sauté onion, garlic, and ground beef until browned. Mix in rice, tomato sauce, oregano, salt, and pepper. Stuff peppers with the mixture, top with cheese, and bake for 25-30 minutes.

name: Pesto Pasta
cooking_instructions: Cook pasta until al dente. Blend basil, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, Parmesan, salt, and pepper to form a pesto. Toss the pasta with the pesto sauce and serve immediately.

name: Pumpkin Soup
cooking_instructions: Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil until soft. Add pumpkin and cumin, stir briefly. Pour in vegetable stock, bring to a boil, and simmer until pumpkin is tender. Blend until smooth, stir in coconut milk, and season with salt and pepper.

name: Cinnamon Apple Oatmeal
cooking_instructions: Combine oats, milk (or water), and a pinch of salt in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer and stir in diced apple and cinnamon. Cook until oats are soft. Drizzle with honey before serving.

name: Beet Salad
cooking_instructions: Toss roasted beets with arugula. Crumble goat cheese on top, add toasted walnuts, drizzle with a mixture of balsamic vinegar and olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.

name: Quinoa Salad
cooking_instructions: Cook quinoa as per package instructions and let cool. Toss with cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, feta, and olives. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, then season with salt and pepper.

name: Baked Falafel
cooking_instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Blend chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, flour, salt, and pepper until combined. Form small patties, place on a baking tray, lightly spray with olive oil, and bake for 20-25 minutes until golden.

name: Focaccia Bread
cooking_instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water. Mix with flour, salt, and olive oil to form a dough. Let rise for 1 hour. Flatten the dough into a baking tray, dimple with fingers, drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle rosemary and coarse salt, and bake at 425°F (220°C) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Lentil Curry
cooking_instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in a pot. Stir in curry powder, turmeric, and cumin. Add lentils, diced tomatoes, and coconut milk. Simmer for 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender. Season with salt and garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Mango Smoothie
cooking_instructions: Combine mango, banana, yogurt, orange juice, and honey in a blender. Add a few ice cubes and blend until smooth. Serve chilled.
